ResponsesInList.Title: Deft response block adds Jitsi support
ResponsesInList.Text: The new version of the Deft response block (1.3) has been released with a new integration with Jitsi Meet project. The block allows meeting elements to be added to a course or activity. Block content can be changed remotely and users can use real time chat and polls. They can also meet with each other using audio and video. Previously it required a remote service for updating content and audio and video. Now you can install your own Jitsi Meet server to provide that functionality instead of using the remote media server. The older servive remains available for convenience.

ResponsesInList.Title: Deft response block adds Jitsi support
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Daniel The documentation says, "If you wish to use Jitsi Meet, you need to install and configure a Jitsi Meet server locally." Does it mean, we can't connect it to a third party Jitsi server?

ResponsesInList.Title: Deft response block adds Jitsi support
ResponsesInList.Text: It should work with external hosting as long as it is set up of token based authentication and you have an app ID and secret for the Moodle instance. You can use the same App id and secret with the Jitsi activity if you are using that (or Plenary meeting ).

ResponsesInList.Title: Zoom - Using the Plugin vs LTI?
ResponsesInList.Text: Looking to have a discussion around pros and cons of continuing to use the plugin vs moving to LTI integration. The plugin looks to be still well supported. Anyone have any thoughts on this? Plugin vs LTI

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Zoom - Using the Plugin vs LTI?
ResponsesInList.Text: As the current plugin developer, we are maintaining it because it gives additional benefits beyond what the LTI can offer by more closely integrating with Moodle's core functionality. Whether you are pre-assigning breakout rooms using Moodle groups, automatically collecting participation reports, auto-linking to Zoom recordings, or scheduling Webinars instead of Meetings, we include functionality that real people need and not just what Zoom has decided to offer. Plus, if there's functionality that you need, you are in control of your destiny. A lot of organizations will suggest functionality and sometimes provide the code to accomplish it. Those conversation's happen on our GitHub repository.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Zoom - Using the Plugin vs LTI?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Jonathan, is there anywhere I can find out more about the grading and attendance reporting of Zoom sessions within a course? I'm trying to advise on which way to integrate with Zoom, but it's hard to find information on the detailed functioning of either option. many thanks in advance

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Zoom - Using the Plugin vs LTI?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Isabel, Sorry for the delay - we currently have two options for grading and attendance reporting. However, due to limitations in Zoom itself, any method has some level of inaccuracy. For a detailed discussion of the development process for the newer duration-based grading: https://github.com/ncstate-delta/moodle-mod_zoom/pull/477 In summary, one method is "attendance grading", so that when the student clicks to join the meeting from Moodle they get full credit for attending the meeting. The newer duration-based method gives percentage credit based on the duration of attendance. The newer method is complicated, because it relies heavily on the data that is available in Zoom and matching up the attendee information with the Moodle user information is not always exact, so manual editing may be needed in varying amounts depending on how the Zoom meetings and the Zoom plugin activities are configured. Here is the grading method help text: Choose the method to use when grading student participation. Upon entry: the student receives full marks (max grade) when they click to join the meeting in Moodle. Attendance duration: the student receives a score based on the percentage of their meeting attendance compared to the total meeting duration. Notes regarding Attendance duration method:

ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Susan, I've been searching for this exact question, so I was wondering how you got on? Did you implement one or the other?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Zoom - Using the Plugin vs LTI?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Isabel, We have been successfully using the Zoom plug-in for a few years now and are happy with it. We are currently on moodle v4.1.

ResponsesInList.Title: Cannot delete Moodle courses with no longer existing BBB activity
ResponsesInList.Text: Dear Community, We have used Big Blue Button a few years ago and it was used in some Moodle courses. Now the BBB server no longer exists. I get the following error message when I try to delete the Moodle course: Error: Argument 1 passed to mod_bigbluebuttonbn\instance::__construct() must be an instance of cm_info, null given, called in [ dirroot ]/mod/bigbluebuttonbn/classes/instance.php on line 139 Deleting the Moodle course is not possible. Does anyone have a solution for the problem? thanks & best regards Anton

ResponsesInList.Title: Cannot delete Moodle courses with no longer existing BBB activity
ResponsesInList.Text: Dear Community, I think I have found a solution. Perhaps it will also work for others: I think that the BBB plugin accesses the BBB server when deleting the courses in order to delete the recording there as well. Our old server data is still stored in the Moodle backend (bigbluebuttonbn_server_url), but the server no longer exists.Â In my opinion, this causes the error message in Moodle and the course can therefore not be deleted. Our solution is as follows: we still have a server URL and the token of an old BBB test instance that is still running. We have entered this URL and token in the backend. Now the courses can also be deleted - even if the recordings do not exist on this test server. At least it works for us. best regards, Anton

ResponsesInList.Title: recurring bbb meeting
ResponsesInList.Text: how can i make the bbb meeting repeated every week

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: recurring bbb meeting
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi ahmed alwa, BBB meetings work more like rooms which are open until the teacher schedules them to be closed than instances that repeat at set times. So to answer your question, there is no straightforward way to do it. There are workarounds that might work for you, depending on what you want to accomplish e.g. one BBB activity that has an open and closing time that is edited every week

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: recurring bbb meeting
ResponsesInList.Text: An idea, works only if the teacher has an account on the BBB server , not going through the Moodle BBB plug-in . - Visit bbbserver/rooms and reate a new "room" on the BBB server and start it. You'll get a link like bbbserver/rooms/xxx-xxx-xx-xxx/join and an access code. - On Moodle create a URL resource for that link. You can put the access code in its description. - Use the availability options Moodle offers to limit the access to what you want. Of course if you give the access code in the description, the student can go there any time - and meet others! You have to judge whether that is OK with your audience. Otherwise, there must be ways of rotating the access code, etc.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Bigbluebutton maximum time and forced logout for all meetings
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Antonello Pau, the scheduling in Moodle handles a user's ability to enter the room (between the start and end time) however once a user is in the room, they will not be kicked out because the end date and time has passed. There is the 'duration' parameter, primarily used for API calls, which sets the maximum length for a meeting. However there is no way to set this with the UI in Moodle.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Exception - Class 'plugin' not found
ResponsesInList.Text: Ok so that was the same day that mine went down. So I'm guessing it's something to do with the Sept / Oct change. Maybe an expired SSL certificate. I've no idea to be honest. How are you managing SSL?

ResponsesInList.Title: Ri: Re: Exception - Class 'plugin' not found
ResponsesInList.Text: In Sept, 30 there was the Let's Encrypt CA expiration: search on google and you'll find many hints about this problem. Anyway, the exception it's not related to this, but it seems that you have one of these situations: PHP version not adequate to the moodle release you're using (most probable) BBB plugin version for a different moodle release or a development one (less probable) Check them with the official documentation for the moodle release last installed.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Ri: Re: Exception - Class 'plugin' not found
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi - thanks a lot for the response. The PHP version is fine - I'm running 7.3.0 with Moodle 3.11.3+ I also have the correct BBB plugin version Also the plugin was working fine before October 1st so I don't think the PHP version can be the problem. Can you think of any reason the Let's Encrypt CA expiration could have an effect. I can reach my BBB server OK from the Moodle container. My PHP instance is in a different container on the same network. I'm using this proxy server: https://github.com/nginx-proxy/nginx-proxy - to manage the moodle installation and other subdomains. From my PHP container: strace -e openat wget -O - https://examplebbserver.com/bigbluebutton/ returns ERROR: The certificate of 'examplebbbserver.com' has expired. Is this relevant at all? Thanks for your time

ResponsesInList.Title: Ri: Re: Ri: Re: Exception - Class 'plugin' not found
ResponsesInList.Text: Yes... Your PHP container does not own updated ca-certificates chains, so when your moodle PHP code tries to contact bbb's API, the https connection fails.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Ri: Re: Ri: Re: Exception - Class 'plugin' not found
ResponsesInList.Text: Ok - yep that did it. 1. I downloaded the PEM chain of the BBB server from Firefox -(clicking on the padlock > connection secure > more information > view certificate > download PEM chain 2. Copied the complete chain as .crt files to /usr/share/ca-certificates/ on the php container 3. Ran update-ca-certificates on the php container 4. Ran dpkg-reconfigure ca-certificates on the php container 5. Checked I could now connect to the BBB server from the PHP container using strace -e openat wget -O - https://examplebbserver.com/bigbluebutton/ 6. Got the success code 7. Checked on Moodle and everything is good. Thanks for the support

ResponsesInList.Title: Ri: Backup course with BBB recording
ResponsesInList.Text: AFAIK , the BBB recordings stay on the BBB server , so into the backup, there will be the resources/ activities that will point to the recordings, but not the recordings themselves (usually they are very large). To transfer the BBB recordings, you should transfer/copy them between the BBB servers involved.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Scalelite (Lazy Deployment) and Bigbluebutton
ResponsesInList.Text: Hey Davide, I already told you this. The fact that the BBB server is behind Scalelite or any other Loadbalancer does not affect the outcome. BBB is the one performing the callback. The payload that comes from BBB is received by Moodle through the plugin and stored in the mdl_bigbluebuttonbn_logs table. So, if you wanted to extract that data from there you need other plugin. I am guessing that some report plugin or external application such as intelliboard would help you (just guessing).

ResponsesInList.Title: Ri: Re: Scalelite (Lazy Deployment) and Bigbluebutton

We noticed that irregular exits from the meeting (for example closing the browser window) are not noted in the log file. Thank you so much for your valuable work

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Ri: Re: Scalelite (Lazy Deployment) and Bigbluebutton
ResponsesInList.Text: No, they are not tracked. And there is no way to track those exits because right now there is no way to stream data into Moodle (a BBB limitation) and there is no way to process batch events in Moodle and tie them to a correct timestamp (a Moodle limitation).

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Installing two bigbluebutton plugins
ResponsesInList.Text:
```text
#!/bin/bash
# Change  BigBlueButton Module Name.
# Module version = 2019042009
# Module release = 2.3.4
#
# If you do not have rename installed, install it first
# sudo apt install rename
#
# --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
find . -type f -exec sed -i 's/bigbluebuttonbn/liveclass1/g' {} +
find . -type d -execdir rename 's/bigbluebuttonbn/liveclass1/' '{}' \+
find . -type f -exec rename 's/bigbluebuttonbn/liveclass1/' '{}' \;
# --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
find . -type f -exec sed -i 's/BigBlueButtonBN/LiveClass1/g' {} +
find . -type f -exec sed -i 's/BIGBLUEBUTTONBN/LIVECLASS1/g' {} +
find . -type f -exec sed -i 's/BIGBLUEBUTTON/LIVECLASS1/g' {} +
find . -type f -exec sed -i 's/icon-bigbluebutton/icon-liveclass1/g' {} +
```

When we record a session it is taking more than 24 hours to appear in moodle. many recording made two days ago didn't show up yet the processed files is empty /var/bigbluebutton/recording/process/presentation the published files is emptyÂ /var/bigbluebutton/recording/publish/presentation/ they only show up in the playbackÂ /var/bigbluebutton/published/presentation we run bbb-conf --check and bbb-conf --status and they showed nothing wrong

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: BBB recordings are taking very long time to appear
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Elie, Let me start by poining out that this is not the best place for posting this question. Since it is BBB related you may be better off by asking in the bigblubutton-dev google group. But, you are correct. The recording processor is a single thread process and that is exactly what happens when meetings are to big or the server is processing too many. There have been plans over the years of re-implementing the recording processor but stability and features on the core components always trump this initiative. Let's remember though that the single server deployment is not meant to be run at high scale. In that spirit, and if you don't want to write your own recording processor (which is what every single company in BBB ecosystem is doing for scaling their clusters), you could have multiple bigbluebutton servers under Scalelite. You would not gain speed and compute power by spreading meeting, therefore recording processing between servers, but at the same time, you would increase your capacity for live sessions.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: BBB 2.2.21 : "Condition: start condition failed at ..."
ResponsesInList.Text: That's normal. It means that your processing service finished to process (ie. convert to MP4/webm/opus etc) all your recordings and now it stopped. It will resume again once more /var/bigbluebutton/recording/status/sanity/*.done files appear (i.e. raw recording content that has passed sanity check service and it is now ready to be processed).

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Some Recordings from BBB don't show up on moodle
ResponsesInList.Text: hello - our fix was down to a problem with our scalelite setup rather than BBB. BBB was correctly publishing the recordings. The import script is specific to scalelite and just copies the completed published recordings from individual BBB servers to the central scalelite server. The script is here if you have scalelite - /usr/local/bigbluebutton/core/scripts I've updated our BBBBN plugin to 2.3.4 and moodle to 3.9 today and all is working correctly for us so don't think the plugin is the culprit. Are you using scalelite or is it a single BBB instance? Are any recordings being published? They can start to take days if you stick with webm format and have a lot of sessions on the go. In our busiest period (we had 4 BBB servers and rang between 400-600 users across them with 5-10 meeting, only one webcam showing on each meeting thankfully) I had to change to mp4 (which also made my IOS users happy) to get recordings showing up in anything like a sensible timeframe. Have you used the bbb-record command? Used with --watch it will at least show you the various workers are running - https://docs.bigbluebutton.org/dev/recording.html I also used to fish around the /var/bigbluebutton/published/presentation/ folder, ls -ltr will show latest recordings at bottom which can help diagnose problems. If you haven't signed up to the BBB google groups I would recommend it. I have fixed most problems with a combination of these moodle forums with the google groups.

ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Ricardo, Yeah, that is a BBB issue. A big one. I was not aware of that. And I just reported to the guys who work on the recordings. The recordings are still there. It seems to be the API that is not picking them up. This means that, because it has nothing to do with Moodle or the Plugin, they will show up again after BBB is updated (or patched). Hopefully there will be an update soon. I would recommend you to keep an eye on the bigbluebutton-dev mailing list. Cheers, JF

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Some Recordings from BBB don't show up on moodle
ResponsesInList.Text: Alright, I broke my own BBB server :D. And I don't know where exactly the problem is, but I passed the report along. There are two things you can try. 1. Restart your BBB server. It seems that the update includes changing one of the libraries required by the API for accessing the recordings. Since the API is still running, it has the reference to the old version. On restart, the API starts using the new one. 2. If that doesn't work, what worked for me (I was doing something else) was to run bbb-install.sh again (in the same way I did a few weeks ago) right after performing the apt-get update. Can you please report back which one of the procedures (if any) worked for you? Thanks, JF

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Can i host Moodle and BigBlueButton together on a sever?
ResponsesInList.Text: You could, if you had a server that is large enough for supporting BBB, but with a major tweak to nginx, and only under specific circumstances that include to be using Ubuntu 18.04, to install Moodle on Nginx manually. And even in that case, we (the BBB and BN developers) don't recommend to go that way. You will be better off by installing BBB in a separated machine. JF

ResponsesInList.Title: BBB plugin - recording files
ResponsesInList.Text: I have a server that is cloud and I set up BBB in it. I have another server which I set up moodle in it with big storage. My question is how can I save recording videos in my moodle server what i mean can I save recordings in moodle as i don't have enough storage in BBB server? best regards

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: BBB plugin - recording files
ResponsesInList.Text: You cannot do that. The recordings are actually stored in the BigBlueButton server. What you see in the Room or Acivity are links that are tetrieved form the BBB server once (and only while) the recordings are available in the BigBlueButton server after being processed. What you could do is to mount some external disk to your BBB server, NFS or something else. But that will require major surgery. You can find documentation about that in https://docs.bigbluebutton.org or ask for more ideas in bigbluebutton-setup mailing list.

ResponsesInList.Title: Improving Web Conferencing Software
ResponsesInList.Text: (Post removed on request of poster)

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Improving Web Conferencing Software
ResponsesInList.Text: HI Jules, We would LOVE to have HTML5 BBB on Moodle. Flash is out of the question for us. It seems there is a release but we cant access it on the blindsidenetworks test server . This seems to be taking an awfully long time. The demo was out in 2017. I'm keen to be interviewed. Rob Mills

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Improving Web Conferencing Software
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Rob, Good news.Â  We have released BigBlueButton 2.2-beta, which is the first version where the HTML5 client comes to the foreground as the main client. We made the announcement here to our bigbluebutton-dev mailing list: https://groups.google.com/d/msg/bigbluebutton-dev/34SphncjKEw/KJZsbQbEAQAJ . Here's a quote from our announcement The BigBlueButton HTML5 client runs without plugins. There is no Flash, no Java , and no mobile app needed to run the HTML5 client.Â  The client takes advantage of the latest capabilities of FireFox and Chrome (the recommended browsers on the desktop) and mobile Safari (for iOS 11+ iPhones and iPads). The HTML5 client uses the browser's support for web real-time communication (webRTC) to send and receive high-quality audio, video, and screen sharing.Â  You'll find the shared video of higher quality than the Flash client.Â  We use FreeSWITCH for WebRTC audio and Kurento for WebRTC video/screen sharing. The HTML5 client implements the full capabilities for the presenter upload presentation, pan/zoom, and annotate using whiteboard tools (including multi-user whiteboard). The HTML5 client offers more collaboration capabilities (compared with the Flash client) including built-in shared notes (using EtherPad) and ability to share YouTube video during the session (though the shared YouTube video does not appear yet in the recording). The HTML5 client runs on desktop, laptop, chromebook, and mobile devices.Â  It implements a responsive interface (written in React) that automatically adapts to the screen size.Â  This means the *same* code and interface is now running across all these devices.Â  For mobile devices there is no app to install. The HTML5 client runs with the mobile browser which on iOS is mobile Safari browser and on Android is Chrome.Â  These browsers support using WebRTC to send/receive audio and video.Â  The supported operating systems on mobile devices is iOS 11+ for Apple iPhones/iPads and Android 6.0+.Â  The device must support the h.264 codec (which is supported by iOS and most Android phones). We've been testing earlier builds of the HTML5 client on our test server at https://test.bigbluebutton.org/ . While BigBlueButton anyone can use BigBlueButton as a general web conferencing system, the project focuses on the needs of the instructor and student for online learning. With our announcement, anyone can setup their own BigBlueButton server (with HTML5 client as default) by following the install steps at: http://docs.bigbluebutton.org/html/html5-install.html . Regards,... Fred Dixon BigBlueButton HTML5 developer

ResponsesInList.Title: BBB instance type explanation needed
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, Can you explain mod_bigbluebuttonbn version 2.2.6 (2017101014) settings; 1. When you create a new BBB-activity on course you can choose instance type Room/Activity with recordings Room/Activity only Recordings only What is the difference between these settings? 2. Under "Activity/Room settings"-topic you can choose "Session can be recorded" Why is this setting here if instance type dictates that the session can be recorded? Or do you need both: "Room/Activity with recordings" "Session can be recorded" before you can record the session?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: BBB instance type explanation needed
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Urpo, Very simple. Room/Activity with recordings, is the normal and regular room we have had since BigBlueButtonBN version 2.0. Meaning an instance that can be used for joining sessions that may be recorded. If they are and have recording linked to them, the recordings are shown at the bottom. Room Activity only, similar to the first one, BUT with no recordings. This instances won;t give the users even the possibility of recording the session. It is normally used for give students an space for collaboration with no need to be worried about space or the content they recorded. If an existen room is changed to this type, the existent recordings will remain in BBB but they won't be shown. Recordings only, Since the inception of BigBlueButtonBN version 2.2, the plugin named RecordingsBN that was used for showing all the recordings in a course, has been phased out. The reason for that is that there was too many duplicated code and it is always more difficult to maintain more than one plugin. Specially when they have similar functionality. So, In order to have an instance for showing all the recordings in one course you select this type. You can also use this type if you want to show only one recording (or a small set of them) by importing recording from another instance in the same course, or even in a different one. I hope this clarifies things. Cheers, JF

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: BBB instance type explanation needed
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, Thanks for answering my first question. If I use Room/Activity with recordings do I still need to choose also Session can be recorded -checkbox ? If so don't you think this is redudant now when you can choose this with the room type?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: BBB instance type explanation needed
ResponsesInList.Text: Well, I think you have your response already but anyways, I'll give you a use case :D. Lets say a teacher wants to have a room with recordings for student collaboration showing a recording from a different course but only want them to have meetings thatÂ  should not be recorded. You may argue that students won't have access to start/stop recordngs anyways, but they could if you want to give them moderator capabilites. I know, the convinations are endless, but this is the thing, this plugin has been growing in features and capabilities based on user requests. What does't make much sense to you may be the only way to solve someone else problem. My advice is always to look for the settings that will work for you particular use cases and try to set them up by default, this way your users don't have to be worried for too many combinations. I would say that in your case, if you prefer no to see the checkbox but still want to have all the meetings with the option for being recorded, add this to your config.php $CFG->bigbluebuttonbn['recording_default'] = 1; $CFG->bigbluebuttonbn['recording_editable'] = 0; I hope this helps. JF

ResponsesInList.Title: Password protect BBB virtual classroom

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Password protect BBB virtual classroom
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Gred, Negative. That use case (access with password after the user is already authenticated!) is not covered and it has never been intended to cover it. For restricting access to a room to some users (including teachers) you could use groups and to use an special role for those teachers (non-editing teacher may be used, but I would rather create a custom one for that particular use case. Lets call it TA). Then you enroll the TAs into the course/groups you want them to have access, and for the activity you can add them as moderators in the list of participants. The groups should be set up as "separated". You may have to play aroundÂ  with the options until you get the set up you need. Good luck, Jesus Federico

ResponsesInList.Title: BigBlueButton - is there a way to NOT show the recordings to the students
ResponsesInList.Text: We let students record their sessions in BBB, but theÂ BigBlueButtonBN plugin shows the recordings afterwards, also to the students, which we do not want. Is there a way that the recordings are hidden for the students but shown for the teacher? WE use BBB 1.1 with the latest plugin. The old BBB plugins were fine in that, but now the recordings are integrated in theÂ BigBlueButtonBN plugin. A pity because there is another plugin specially for showing the recordings. Hope to hear from you. Many thanks. Nick

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: BigBlueButton - is there a way to NOT show the recordings to the students
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Nick, I think there is a misconception here on what the capabilities in the previous version were and the ones the current one are. With BigBlueButtonBN 2.1.x the recordings belonging to a Room were also shown to all the uses who have access to the Room. RecordingsBN was used as a view in order to show ALL the recordings in a course. But this use case was not changed at all. With BigBlueButtonBN 2.2, the functionality offered by these two plugins was merged, which means that you can have an instance that has a Room/Activity with no recordings, it can be a Room/Activity showing its own recordings (same as the standard Room in v2.1.x) or a resource with Recordings only (same as an instance of the previous RecordingsBN) The use case you are trying to cover has never been considered, although you were able to hide the recordingsBN instance from students using the Moodle capabilities. Nonetheless, there is a workaround you could try. This would be to create a group per user in that course and enroll them. Students should see only the recordings for the group (or groups) they belong, but Teachers should be able to see all of them. I hope this helps. JF

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: I can not configure my server ip for moodle
ResponsesInList.Text: Your BigBlueButton server is not correctly installed. You have to follow the steps in this document (including the troubleshooting part as you have some issues there) http://docs.bigbluebutton.org/install/install.html As this issue has nothing to do with Moodle, you should look for help in the BigBlueButton mailing lists. https://groups.google.com/forum/#!forum/bigbluebutton-setup The main problem is that you installed BBB in the same server you installed Moodle. And even though that is possible, it requires some black magic for proxying the requests. You should better install them in separated boxes. I don't know what exactly you did, but right now it seems that you have two applications listening the port 80. You have to have a way to redirect the request to the application you really want. JF

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Big Blue Button sessions keep disconnecting
ResponsesInList.Text: This is an issue entirely related to BigBlueButton itself and no to the Moodle plugin. If you have your own BigBlueButton server you may want to try asking for help in the bigbluebutton mailing lists. https://groups.google.com/forum/#!forum/bigbluebutton-dev or https://groups.google.com/forum/#!forum/bigbluebutton-setup If you are using test-install (the server that comes by default), there may have been an issue with the server at the time you were testing. The problems don't usually just happen, so an update was in process or it is on its way. With test-install you either have to be patient and wait or report it to the bigbluebutton mailing list as it may be an issue the developers are not aware of. Cheers, JF

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Big Blue Button sessions keep disconnecting
ResponsesInList.Text: The plugin doesn't do anything by itself. The plugin let you create Moodle activities that will let you make use of some functionality inside the LMS, BUT, you have to have a BigBlueButton server where to run the meetings. It is true that the plugin comes pre-configured to work with a BigBlueButton server provided for free by Blindside Networks, BUT (again) it is not meant to be for production, only for testing. It is OK if you use the server as much as you need/want. The server works normally fine, but as it is used (for free) by lots of users daily it may be overloaded in times. Also it always runs the latest build with gives users access to all the new features and capabilities, although the downside of that is also that in times there may be hidden bugs not detected in development. Cheers, JF

ResponsesInList.Title: Looking for bigger Big Blue Button users
ResponsesInList.Text: Dear all, We are running a Moodle site with 10 000+ users and a virtual classroom installation with up to 500 simultaneous users. We are looking for an alternative virtual classroom that can support this number of simultaneous users (divided over a dozen concurrentÂ  sessions or more). We have been looking at BBB now and again and recently it has started to include the functionality we need (recording, breakout rooms, etc.), so now I wonder if there are any users of BBB out there who have installations of similar or bigger size, so that I can ask them about the hardware infrastructure we would require to set up a server that is sufficiently powerful for our needs. I also have a number of questions about possible functionality (to which I have not yet been able to find the answers on-line): Can one BBB server serve virtual classrooms to two Moodle sites if they are in the same Moodle server? Does the Moodle integration limit BBB sessions to accept only users authenticated via Moodle, or is it also possible to have people from outside of Moodle access the session (acccess via a link)? Will the number of Breakout rooms be flexible (5 seems to few for our class sizes)? Thanks in advance for any information you can share. Rgrds, Paul.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Looking for bigger Big Blue Button users
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Paul, Can one BBB server serve virtual classrooms to two Moodle sites if they are in the same Moodle server? Yes, it can serve multiple Moodle sites, servers an even other systems (like Wordpress) with no problem. Each session will have its own meetinID therefore users will join the meetings they have access to. Does the Moodle integration limit BBB sessions to accept only users authenticated via Moodle, or is it also possible to have people from outside of Moodle access the session (acccess via a link)? The Moodle integration only allows access through Moodle activities , and only to authenticated users will be able to join. For allowing access through a shared link you would need to tailor an special link. The plugin does not provide that capability. Will the number of Breakout rooms be flexible (5 seems to few for our class sizes)? The number of 5 rooms is fixed and it was defined that way to simplify the UI JF

ResponsesInList.Title: [BBB] RecordingsBN uses internal IP address instead of domain
ResponsesInList.Text:
For some reason, RecordingsBN uses a playback presentation link with my internal IP address from Amazon AWS EC2 instead of the external IP or domain . An entry of a recording looks like this: 
```text
http://172.x.x.x
/playback/presentation/0.9.0/playback.html?meetingId=xxxxx-xxx
```
 instead of 
```text
https://bbb.mydomain.com/
...
```
 AFAICS, the only occurence of my internal IP address in the bbb configuration is /usr/local/bigbluebutton/core/scripts/bigbluebutton.yml : 
```text
playback_host: 172.x.x.x


playback_protocol: https
```
 Should this point to my domain, external IP or internal IP? Maybe someone can point me in the right direction to find the cause of this. bbb-record --check also does not output anything. Versions: RecordingsBN: 1.3.0-beta BBB: 1.0 Moodle: 3.0

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: [BBB] RecordingsBN uses internal IP address instead of domain
ResponsesInList.Text: RecordingsBN uses a playback presentation as it is/was received from BBB. So, what you need to fix is either the endpoint on BBB or the recordings already processed. If you haven done it yet, execute this command sudo bbb-conf --setip bbb.yourdomain.com You'll need to restart the server , but once fixed the new recordings will have the new endpoint. Now, for fixing the recordings already processed, you need to reprocess them. sudo bbb-record --rebuild <recordID> You can find more information in the BBB documentation http://docs.bigbluebutton.org/dev/recording.html#process and more help with BBB in BBB forums. https://groups.google.com/forum/#!forum/bigbluebutton-users

ResponsesInList.Text: This is a rare situation. I exchanged the IP addresses of both servers in the past. When changing them the virtual network adapter eth0:0 with its original IP address was set on the server with the moodle-instance. ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Create BBB-Activity does not work
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Rudolf, I am glad you solved your problem. Error code: general_error_unable_connect Generally speaking means that your Moodle server was not able to communicate with your BigBlueButton server. That can be a firewall issue, a DNS issue, routing issue, etc. Just in case anyone else faces this problem, the best way to test it is to execute in your console: curl http://your-bbb-server/bigbluebutton/api The response should be an XML file, the same you get if you use that URL in the browser. If that doesn't work you can confirm that the connectivity issue is there and more likely you'll get a message error telling you where exactly the problem is. Regards, JF

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Create BBB-Activity does not work

ResponsesInList.Title: Issue with BBB Recordings
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi All, I currently have Moodle 2.85 installation with the latest BBB plugins. I am using Genericconf as the BBB server . When I create an activity for a BBB recording it records the session as I can see this in the Genericconf logs. However when I have created the BBBrecordings resource and click on it there is no recording, it is completely blank. Yet, when I use the Blindside networks test server I can see the recording correctly. I am helping a client out who is on a budget here in Australia. I am only a novice user of Moodle so any hope or pointers of how to get things behaving would be appreciated. Thank you in advance.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Issue with BBB Recordings
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Tina, First thing you need to check is if the recording or recordings actually exist in the BigBlueButton server you are trying to connect. If you are running a BBB 0.9, sometimes the users forget to push the recording button (even though the meeting was set to be recorded, the user must push the button to really start recording). Or for any versions, sometimes the recording was not processed for some reason. I would recommend you to do a direct request to the BBB server by using api-mate http://mconf.github.io/api-mate/ (or ask to your system administrator to do so) You can query all the recordings and look for the one you need by title, or if the recordings are too many then you need the internal meeting ID and query for recordings in that specific meetingID. Let us know your findings

ResponsesInList.Text: Thank you Jesus. Â I have entered the data into the that link. How do I tell if the recording exist from it please. I am the technical person trying to solve this, I am more a support person than a web support person. Once I can understand the output of the link I can give you that information and we can resolve this issue. I have looked at the Generic Conf and I can see that the meetings have been recorded on their server.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Issue with BBB Recordings
ResponsesInList.Text: Looking at the API Mate. I clicked on getRecordings and it returned code "Success" so I assume that the recording is present on the Generic Conf server given that information. And then when I click on publishRecordings I get "Success" and "True". I hope that is the information you needed from that tool. Thank you.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Issue with BBB Recordings
ResponsesInList.Text:
Hi Tina, Not necessarily. And I am afraid you need to have a good understanding of how the recordings are managed in the BBB server. Are you doing the getRecording request for the specific meeting you are looking for? The BigBluebuttonBN plugin will show you only the recordings related to the BigBlueButtonBN activities in the course it is. If there are recordings in the BBB server from other courses you will see them by using the getRecordings command, but they don't necessarily belong to the course where you have the recordingsBN instance. You need to execute the query for the specific meetingID you are looking for. You can see that ID if you launch into a session from your moodle and while you are in you run a getMeetings command using apimate Take that ID and use it to recover the recordings. If after the recording is made you have recordings in the recordings element, so all is good. NExt thing to look at is the connectivity between your Moodle server and the BBB server The response is always an XML file like this <response><returncode>SUCCESS</returncode><recordings/><messageKey>noRecordings</messageKey><message>There are not recordings for the meetings</message></response> If there is success and no recordings. Well there are just no recordings. If there is success and there are recordings, in the element recordings you should see something like this for each recording in that server: 
```text
<recording>
   <recordID>26961dd06cd95364e5fc58cdb3e69837609b59ee-1414094627549</recordID>
   <meetingID>3c9da89e522728730c41bd16c82624d4-2-1</meetingID>
   <name>BBB Test</name>
   <published>true</published>
   <startTime>1414094627000</startTime>
   <endTime>1414095020000</endTime>
   <
metadata
>
      <originservername>192.168.22.147</originservername>
      <contextactivitydescription>Test</contextactivitydescription>
      <contextactivity>BBB Test</contextactivity>
      <origin>Moodle</origin>
      <recording>true</recording>
      <
context
>English 101</context>
      <originversion>2.7 (Build: 20140512)</originversion>
      <originservercommonname />
      <origintag>moodle-mod_bigbluebuttonbn (2014101002)</origintag>
   </metadata>
   <playback>
      <format>
         <type>presentation</type>
         <url>http://ANYURL/presentation</url>
         <length>7</length>
      </format>
   </playback>
</recording>

(Moderators of course still have the option, because they will be leading the session) Can we make this change via the Moodle plugin or do we have to make the change on the BBB server ? ResponsesInList.Title: Re: BigBlueButton: Viewers join with Listen Only
ResponsesInList.Text: As you stated it, the only way is to use a config.xml for each of the two roles. Unfortunately the current version of the BigBlueButtonBN plugin does not support the use of BBB dynamic config.xml. You would need to implement it making the changes to the Moodle plugin. There are some examples you can use, but they are in Java http://demo.bigbluebutton.org/demo/demo12.jsp And the documentation for this API feature is here https://code.google.com/p/bigbluebutton/wiki/API

ResponsesInList.Title: Server Specs - BigBlueButton
ResponsesInList.Text: Looking for opinions!! I have been running BBB on a server that does not meet even the minimum specs.Â  (2.0GHz Dual Core, 4GB RAM, 350GB Hard Drive) I ran it for testing purposes, the most I would ever have connect is 20, before I would see the load begin to be too high. The test has been successful, and now I want to go live with a new server.Â Â  I know I want to be above the minimum specs I hope to have up to 100 users on at a time.Â  I hope to find out what others are running their BBB on and how many users are on it Mike

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Server Specs - BigBlueButton
ResponsesInList.Text: Mike, Per usual with this type of system and deployment - your specific environment and the setups of your students will have a significant impact on how everything performs. Most of the time our server is in use it has between 30-70 concurrent users. We maxed it out at 124 - once. It worked, but I did notice some mildly degraded audio, especially in the recording. Based on monitoring, we believe that was more a function of running into bandwidth limits (on our client side) rather than pushing the server to any sort of limits. We have a fully virtualized infrastructure - for production systems we make sure we slightly under-provision the underlying hardware. Our BBB installation is running with 8 cores (the underlying system is 2.3GH Xeons) and 16GB of RAM. The filesystem is running on a flash-based subsystem.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Unable to connect to the BigBlueButton server
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Miki, If the configuration by default works so the plugin and the moodle server configuration are correct. So there are a few things you may want to check: First. By chance, are you missing the protocol in the url? >url setting like this: " 10.0.9.92/bigbluebutton/" It should be http://10.0.9.92/bigbluebutton/ , if that is the url you use to access to your BBB server, which by the way, assuming you have a n standard and complete installation, it should show you the demo page. Also, if you test this URL in your browser http://10.0.9.92/bigbluebutton/api/ do you get the same XMl you got from the test-install server? You should. If you don't so your BBB server is broken. And finally, did you replace the salt (AKA shared secret) by default with the one used by your server? The one that comes by default only works for test-install, at least you replace the salt in your BBB server. By the way, the XML response you got in the browser has nothing to do with the response your Moodle server should get. That only means that your client computer can communicate with the BBB server, but doesn't mean the Moodle server can. JF

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Unable to connect to the BigBlueButton server
ResponsesInList.Text:
Hi Mike, Thanks for sharing your experience. You can also try restarting the server but you should not really need it for diagnosis. The first thing you want to try is of course to make sure that the target BBB server is working fine using the demo page installed by default. When you are trying to make the plugin to work for the very first time, we recommend testing with the configuration by default. If that works you can discard a bunch of things. If these two conditions are fulfilled, then you can proceed with changing the URL and SALT. Now, if after these three steps you still have problems, the first thing I would check is communication between servers. Making a wget call from the Moodle server to the BBB server can give you a good idea about what can be possible wrong. 
```text
wget -O - 
http://demo.bigbluebutton.org/bigbluebutton/api
```

ResponsesInList.Title: Web Conferencing for Free or Almost Free...
ResponsesInList.Text: I have a small group of students that I conference with so I don't want to pay some host $50 per month.Â  I find that Adobe Connect, BBB, Elluminate, and OpenMeetings only make sense if you have an expensive server and large bandwidth.Â  What if you are just meeting with a few students? Join.Me - https://join.me/ - Free - Supported by LogMeIn company.Â  You install a very small exe on your machine and I've have broadcasted my desktop up to 20 people at the same time. You can allow any of them to control your desktop, it's super easy to chat and send files. Pros: Free Broadcasts desktop up to 20 people with high quality. Can transfer files between host and participants. Participants don't need to install ANY software. Cons: No VOIP - you'll need Skype or something else. No Webcam support Need to install a small piece of software to start. They just need a flash enabled browser. Can't "trade" desktop views. Yvew http://vyew.com/s/ - Shares a whiteboard with everyone. Free up to 10 participantss.Â  Yvew even has a table explaining why Yvew is better than Adobe Connect and WebEx. ( http://vyew.com/site/product/comparison ) Pros: Free (Up to 10 people) Saves your sessions so that people can go back and review. People can easily share pictures, documents, videos. Can make breakout rooms and subchat rooms. Webcam and Audio Support Many Administrator features.. you can give people moderator access if you want. Can share desktops (not tested) Cons: All clients need a flash browser. Video quality of webcam poor compared to Skype. Audio is not as good as well.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Web Conferencing for Free or Almost Free...
ResponsesInList.Text: Skype - Free PROS: Free Best audio and webcam quality on the internet.Â  (Better than Big Blue Button, Adobe Connect, illuminate. Works on Linux, OSX, Windows CONS: Students can't drop in on a conference call after it's started. You have to shut down the entire call and recall everyone Desktop sharing is terrible blurry quality. You also can't control their desktop at all or point at items.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Web Conferencing for Free or Almost Free...
ResponsesInList.Text: As one of the developers of CliqMeet ( https://www.cliqmeet.com ) i would like to share this tool. IMHO : Pros: Free for non commercialized usage, deveoped by a german university startup at the TU Munich Mostly HTML5 (Powered by Node.JS and Websockets, Ready for WebRTC as soon most browsers support it) Share PDF-Presentations, Whiteboard, Files, Watch Videos together, Text Editor, etc Webcam and Audio Support, record your sessions, support for mobile devices by Live-Streaming Widget-Based organization of room with layouts Can share desktop with Teamviewer and Java Cons: Beta, english language 90% supported, you will need a modern browser Please tell us! Give it a try, we would love to get some feedback.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Web Conferencing for Free or Almost Free...
ResponsesInList.Text: Another very good option is RHUB. Its web conferencing servers are easy to use and best part is, it has no download of any kind.

ResponsesInList.Text: We've been playing around with various webinar options for several years, going back to the heyday of DimDim when it seemed like it might actually be an opensource alternative to Adobe. After several years and various solutions we're waiting for BigBlueButton to reach 0.8. I really believe that BigBlueButton is the best cost effective solution. If you have the money and infrastructure for an on-site version of Adobe Connect then I hear the integrations with Moodle are pretty good, but it's not a good solution if you don't have a dedicated installation of Connect under the control of the same group that runs your LMS. BigBlueButton meets almost all of our needs right now, but for us to really commit to it we need recording and playback, which should drop in the next few weeks. At that point we'll re-evaluate moving completely over to an integrated installation of BigBlueButton. Right now we make due with a mix of a few other solutions and upload the recordings after the fact to our instance of Kaltura CE.

ResponsesInList.Title: Audio enabled breakout rooms Re: Moodle With best web conference solution
ResponsesInList.Text: We use Blackboard Collaborate Web Conferencing (formerly "Elluminate Live!", a solution with audio enabled breakout rooms. I did not contribute earlier, because our classroom solution is not open-source. After Blackboard acquired Elluminate some years ago, the famous Moodle bridge plugin disappeared from Moodle Docs Plugin directory. The Elluminate trainer community did wait in vain, how Blackboard, (who is vendor of a commercial LMS also) will handle ElluminateÂ´s Moodle connectivity in the future. Here are the good news: Blackboard did continue to integrate the famous Elluminate engine, now named "Collaborate Web Conferencing" with many LMS (especially all those supporting the LTI standard). CollaborateÂ´s user interface is improved from ElluminateÂ´s plane cockpit GUI, The Java -based engine is still the same and does include audio-enabled breakout-rooms as usual However, recording and playback of actions happening in several breakout rooms might be difficult to handle, several independant audio streams in parallel. It might be a better idea to define several rooms and let participant change the room for group work. This enables you to record each room independantly. Collaborate has a flatrate-like license model limiting the number of seats, but not number of rooms driven in parallel. The dedicated Collaborate-Moodle Integation is currently certified for Moodle up to 2.5x . IÂ´m driving the Collaborate plugin v3.1 on my Moodle 2.6 - without glitches up to now. Please note, that CollaborateÂ´s Moodle plugin is distributed by vendor only and therefore not listed in the Moodle Docs plugin directory. I currently consider this as a conceptual bug of the Moodle Docs site disallowing any documentation about plugins not being distributed there.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: DimDim or Elluminate?
ResponsesInList.Text: I have just started looking into web conferencing. I have used elluminate. It's expensive but it works. I am interested in trying out the BigBlueButton . ( http://bigbluebutton.org/ ) It looks like it has most of the functions that I would need. I never really liked the record features of elluminate simply because I never really wanted to watch long meetings again. However, If you invest $299 in Camtasia studio ( http://www.techsmith.com/camtasia/ ), you can record meetings and then cut out the fluff later. There are some free alternative desktop recording options, but Camtasia is, by far, the best out there. I actually use Camtasia a lot to create training videos and lectures. It would be nice if a web-conferencing programs also allowed the recording and editing features that you find in Camtasia. I have also used Camtasia to record someone else's elluminate meeting. It was a good thing since they forgot to hit record at first and then later realized their voice wasn't being recorded. As of this reply, BigBlueButton was still working out some kinks on their whiteboard feature. However, a good, free whiteboard application/website is scribblar.com . ( http://www.scribblar.com/ ) It allows you to create multiple rooms and each room allows multiple pages. It even allows file sharing and pdf uploads of 5 pages. I have used scribblar for lecture rooms in moodle as well as tutoring rooms. I love the fact that you just have to put a link to the room in the moodle course for others to access the whiteboard. It also allows you to lock the room so that others cannot change or delete things if you have a lesson set up or something. It doesn't have a record feature, but again you can use Camtasia to record a session and post it to YouTube or something later. So, my recommendation would be to use 3 programs: BigBlueButton - although I have only seen demos at this point (But it does have a moodle module.) Scribblar - Easy, powerful, and free whiteboard Camtasia - $299, but well worth the money. You will thank yourself for buying a copy.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: DimDim or Elluminate? BBB 0.71
ResponsesInList.Text: @Alan incase you have not sorted this out; yes you are right that bbb-config --saltset <salt> does change the demo api but note that the salt at /var/lib/tomcat6/webapps/bigbluebutton/demo/bbb_api_conf.jsp is for the demo page, if that did not change, then it should not affect you moodle api, it will only affect your demo page. You need to verify that the salt at "cat /var/lib/tomcat6/webapps/bigbluebutton/WEB-INF/classes/bigbluebutton.properties" is the same as that of your moodle API. cheers

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: DimDim or Elluminate?
ResponsesInList.Text: The marketing policy of DimDim has not been open at all.Â They initially talked a lot about open source nature. Then they started delaying the open source releases and got into open sourceÂ crippleware (no recording feature for example in open source). Now, the delay in open source update is simply too much. In fact, DimDim has most likely used the free word of mouth publicity associated with open source product as a stepping stone.Â Every company has to make money, but if they could be open right from the beginning about their policy, it would have helped. If one was interested in open source only, one would possiblyÂ not have wasted time on DimDim. Having said that, DimDim product looks okay to me for basic web conferencing and scores on ease of use. But,Â the free version gradually is being marginalised and if you use the free version, youÂ notice how much shout is there about upgrade.

ResponsesInList.Title: BBB - Multiple meetings / scheduled mettings
ResponsesInList.Text: I have a client who uses continuous enrolment and needs to run meetings as a "days after enrolment" type schedule. They have worked out a complex system of dates for when different levels of enrolment would be available for the next virtual meeting. Think of it like this: Day 1 : User 1,2 & 3 enrol Day 25: User 4 & 5 enrol Day 30 : Users 1, 2 & 3 do their first scheduled meeting over BBB, share files, do video conferences, that stuff. (Not recorded or assessed) Day 45: More users enrol Day 55 : Users 4 & 5 do their first scheduled meeting Day 60 : Users 1, 2 & 3 have their second scheduled meeting, which is recorded and assessed. etc ... We don't know the calendar dates of "day N", except by counting them out. Days after enrolment type scheduling is a pain, but that's the job. Our second problem is that BBB seems to have a "single activity = single meeting" association. So over time, the course is going to have a stack of use-once-then-discard activities , which is something I'd like to avoid. I'd like to know if there's a way to modify the plugin for moodle (or if there is an existing plugin) that allows multiple schedules for a single activity.

ResponsesInList.Title: Disable camera/audio pop up box
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, When BBB is started it pops up a flash box, asking ifÂ camera/audio sharing is allowd, and if the user wants to join the audio session, is it possible I disable this box and just allowÂ camera/audio by default. Thanks, Paul

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Disable camera/audio pop up box
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Paul, It is not possible to disable this security dialog. There is no one-way only audio in BigBlueButton. Â When a user joins the audio session, the BigBlueButton client creates a two-way audio bridge. The moderator can set all users to join muted, but the underlying audio channel is still two-way, hence the need for the security dialog to request the user's permission for access to webcam and microphone. Regards,... Fred -- BigBlueButton Developer

ResponsesInList.Title: Big Blue Button on Shared Server

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Big Blue Button on Shared Server
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Yusuf, The role of the user when entering BigBlueButton (moderator or viewer) depends on the user's role in Moodle. If they are a student, they will enter the BigBlueButton session as viewer. If they have any other privliges in Moodle beyond student, they will enter BigBlueButton as a moderator. Your probably testing the plugin when logged into your Moodle site as administrator, which is why you are always entering the BigBlueButton session as moderator. Try logging into your Moodle site as a student and enter the BigBlueButton session. Â You should join as a viewer. Regards,... Fred -- BigBlueButton Developer

ResponsesInList.Title: Moodleand Big Blue Button on different servers
ResponsesInList.Text: I am trying to integrate Big Blue Button with Moodle, the BBB readme file says that Moodle & Big Blue Button need to be on different servers? Is there any reason for this requirement? Thanks, Paul

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodleand Big Blue Button on different servers
ResponsesInList.Text: We recommend two different servers mainly due performance but also because it makes easier the administration. Off course if you have a big server and only few users, you could handle the two services in the same box. Just keep in mind that out of the boxÂ BigBlueButton has a web server (nginx) configured to listen the port 80Â (as any other web server has by default). You can deal with the configuration of moodle on nginx or if you want to install a different webserver like apache, you would need to put either of them to listen to a different por, hence to do extra configuration. We as BigBlueButton developers and commercial providers never do that, not even for development, but yes, we have learn of several deployments of both services in one box. So, the use of two servers is highly recommended but it's not mandatorily required. Regards Jesus Federico

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodleand Big Blue Button on different servers
ResponsesInList.Text: Good reply Jesus. Paul, see also this FAQ entry: http://code.google.com/p/bigbluebutton/wiki/FAQ#We_recommend_running_BigBlueButton_on_port_80 Regards,... Fred -- BigBlueButton Developer

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodleand Big Blue Button on different servers

ResponsesInList.Title: BBB Attendance Report in Moodle
ResponsesInList.Text: Reporting "attendance" is one of the selection requirements for a webconferencing software. How is the specific Moodle-initiated BBB session identified to the BBB server ? Is is accessed via a get URL ? If so, to get the start and end time of a participant, two details could be added to that URL : an "entry url" and an "exit url". When the BBB server does a successful get on the entry url, it sends "time of entry" to theÂ mdl_bigbluebuttonbn_log table. When the user exits the session (e.g., via logging out or losing the connection for whatever reason) the BBB server does a get on the exit url and sends the "time of exit" to the mdl_bigbluebuttonbn_log table. Does that make sense?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: BBB Attendance Report in Moodle
ResponsesInList.Text:
Yes, that is the only implementation that could be done by now, but anyway the report would not be 100% reliable.

The exceptions for the use case you are proposing are when the users close the tab or browser, or when the communication fails and the user get disconnected.

There is no problem with joining time, but with the leaving time.

Regards,

Jesus Federico

ResponsesInList.Title: BigBlueButtonBN activity module 1.0.8-b2 just released
ResponsesInList.Text: I want to announce that as part of the efforts for having a really solid integration of BigBlueButton with Moodle we have just released a new version of the BigBlueButtonBN and RecordingBN modules. This is the 1.0.8-b2 release that has been labeled as version 2012081300 for both components, BigBlueButtonBN and RecordingsBN . The main changes and/or improvements included since the previos release are: 1. The schedule parameters that were originaly activated only for activities in section 1 and higher, are now also available for activities in the section 0. 2. There was a serious security issue on internal calls to index.php, ajax .php and bbb-broker. The access was not validated according to the permissions of the users. This issue was registered as CONTRIB-3840 on the Moodle tracking system. 3. A bug was preventing the normal operation of the module on servers accessing bigbluebutton and external services trhought a proxy server . This bug was registered as CONTRIB-3844 on the Moodle tracking system. These are the issues reported by users during the beta one testing phase. If you find anything that you think is a bug or it can be improved, please don't hesitate in letting us know or directly create an issue on the tracking system for the corresponding project ( BigBlueButtonBN or RecordingsBN )

ResponsesInList.Title: OpenMeetings Moodle Mod Version 1.2 and security update with OpenMeetings 1.8.3
ResponsesInList.Text: With the new integration and OpenMeetings version 1.8.3 you can now create separated users in OpenMeetings with the access-level "SOAP-Only". The "SOAP-Only" user can do exactly what is needed to run the integration but nothing more. This does result in no need for any OpenMeetings Admin-User in the Moodle Module config! So you can better protect your OpenMeetings server from non-authorized access via the SOAP Gateway and no need to share confidential account data."SOAP-Only" users can not login to OpenMeetings administration or manipulate user accounts via SOAP. It is recommended to update to the latest version of OpenMeetings (1.8.3). Moodle Mod 0.9 for Moodle 1.9.x is still compatible with OpenMeetings 1.8.3 and you can also use the new secure user with access level "SOAP-Only" with the old Moodle Mod 0.9. Sample Video showing the installation of Moodle Mod and integration with new access level: New features of Moodle Plugin : - Secure "SOAP-Only" user access level (see documentation on top) - 3 Moderation Types for Conference Rooms (Moodle admins, teachers and course creators are automatically a moderator): Moderation Type A) Participants need to wait till the teacher enters the room Moderation Type B) Participants can already start (first User in room becomes moderator) Moderation Type C) Every participant is automatically moderator when he/she enters the room - New Flag "Allow Recording": You can set in the room configuration now a flag that controls if the recording button is available or not You can try and test the Moodle integration at: http://moodle.openmeetings.de Download is available from our project side: http://code.google.com/p/openmeetings/ Support is available at: http://www.openmeetings.de Sebastian

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: rtl languages in bigbluebutton
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Farahnaz, We don't have Right To Left support in BigBlueButton at the moment. Â We've had others request this feature and we've got an enhancement request in place for it http://code.google.com/p/bigbluebutton/issues/detail?id=686 At the moment, we're pretty busy working on BigBlueButton 0.8 (record and playback) and preparing for its upcoming beta release. Once we finish BigBlueButton 0.8, we'll prioritize the features for the next iteration. Â To understand how we priorotize the features, see http://code.google.com/p/bigbluebutton/wiki/FAQ#When_will_feature_X_be_implemented We definitely want to see RTL support in BigBlueButton. Â Implementing RTL would require some rework of the chat interface, along with many other parts of BigBlueButton. Â At the moment, we've not investigated the effort, nor can we give any promises on when we can implement this feature. Regards,... Fred -- BigBlueButton Developer

ResponsesInList.Title: OpenMeetings Moodle Mod 1.1 and OpenMeetings 1.7
ResponsesInList.Text: We are happy to announce Version 1.1 of the Moodle Mod for OpenMeetings. It fixes that updates to the conference room in Moodle are correctly populated to OpenMeetings. OpenMeetings recently was also updated to Version 1.7 with a number of updates: Multi-Whiteboard, you can add new whiteboard instances, each whiteboard can have the full range of tools and documents inside. Advanced File-Explorer, Drag and Drop Interface for managing files, including possibility to create a document tree with folders. Private and Public Drive in File-Explorer. The File-Explorer has two different views, one is the Private Drive and the other the Public Drive . The Private Drive always contains the same files. Those files are only visible to the user currently loggedin. The Public Drive is bound not to the user, but to the conference room. All users in the conference room have access to the Public Drive. Save whiteboards. You can save each whiteboard instance as a file. The file is located in the File-Explorer and can be drag and drop'ed and organized like any other document, image or folder. New User-Level: SOAP/Web-Service only. For security reasons there is a new user-level. You can now create user-accounts that have only the ability to access via SOAP. In former versions you always need an admin account. MyRooms section. Each user has now by default 2 personal rooms that are always accessible exclusive for that user. There are buttons to enter those rooms from the dashboard VoIP-Integration. Together with our Finish partner and the Open Source Department of Kvarken region we have done a VoIP integration by using an applet for the audio part. For further information see VoIPAndSIP And we've updated out website at: http://www.openmeetings.de Sebastian

ResponsesInList.Title: Elluminate Live Module for Moodle 2.0
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, I'm wondering if anybody else that has EL module integrated in their Moodle site has encountered a similar issue when upgrading to Moodle 2.0. We did a test upgrade from M1.9.10 to 2.0.2. We have Elluminate Live module installed in our 1.9, and I was aware that the latest version posted here: http://moodle.org/mod/data/view.php?d=13&rid=557&filter=1 is for 1.9, but I just thought to give it a try and drop it in the upgraded Moodle 2.0, and indeed was unsuccessful. I then found out on Elluminate's website that they have a bridge package that supports Moodle 2.0 and is available from their download page . So I got the package and was about to install it, but on the new block/ mod confirmation page I noticed that it's called 'elluminate' now, not 'elluminatelive', thus moodle will treat it as a new install instead of an upgrade. I looked at some of the upgrade Â and install scripts in the package, and I think all my data in "mdl_elluminatelive_xxxxxxx" tables will not be transferred, which means that currently scheduled meetings will no longer be there and links to the recordings won't appear on the block. So is there any solution/ workaround/ hint to tackle this. Is the Elluminate Live Module posted in the plugin download page still being supported/ further developed to some extent? thank you, Dimas

ResponsesInList.Title: OpenMeetings 1.4 and Moodle Plugin Version 0.9
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, we are happy to announce Version 0.9 of the Moodle Plugin and Version 1.4 of OpenMeetings. Version 0.9 of the Moodle Plugin contains a patch to fix the problem with utf8 characters in moodle usernames (which where displayed wrong in OpenMeetings). OpenMeetings 1.4 adds some new features too: New Features: Remote Desktop Control (RDC) in Screen Sharing and separated right for RDC in user list, Moderators are able by default to do RDC other users can apply for it using the right-buttons New separated right for allowing Screen Sharing and Recording Multi- Domain Support: Separated Admin interface for configuring multiple LDAP configurations with a single OpenMeetings Instance, in the Login Box you are able to choose different domains now, each domain represents a LDAP config (you can still use the internal DB all the time, the internal DB is always in the list) New Room features: Close and open conference rooms. Additionally with a redirect- URL in case the room is closed and SOAP Methods to remotely open and close room. Moderators can also close a room from inside the conference room (Menubar: Actions > Close room). Users which are already loggedin will then be redirected to the redirect URL Fix missing attributes in Backup file and add Meeting-Members New Language: Danish, thx to ALO, update Spanish thx to Jesmargo Various small Bugfixes The complete changelog can be found at: http://code.google.com/p/openmeetings/wiki/ChangeLog Downloads can be retrieved from the project website: http://code.google.com/p/openmeetings/

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Big Blue Button
ResponsesInList.Text: At the risk of being facetious.... have you checked the permissions? The directory and all its contents must be readable by the web server . As the rest of your Moodle site works, the easiest thing to do is to make them the same. Check the ownership as well - that should match too. Failing that... you did something wrong installing the module and some or all of the files are missing. Check, for a start, that the version.php file it is complaining about is really there.

ResponsesInList.Title: New Elluminate Live Module
ResponsesInList.Text: We're using the most recent Elluminate Live module but I noticed that when a teacher adds an elluminate live sessions block, any session from any teacher shows in the block rather than just the sessions for that one course section. Is this the way the block is supposed to work or did we miss a something in the settings?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: SAS Elluminate Live Module
ResponsesInList.Text: The block shows links to the five most recent activities that have recordings available for which the current user can actually access. Generally this means activities in any course the user belongs to. Also, this is about the SAS version of the code which is currently maintained by Elluminate themselves. The initial post subject does not indicate this and duplicates a post of the same name which is about the ELM version of the module.

ResponsesInList.Title: Elluminate Live! integration updated to support server 9.5 / manager 3.0
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks to help from Tanveer Virani at Elluminate, I was able to update the Moodle integration with new code to support the latest release of Elluminate . The code for Moodle version 1.9 was updated and you can download the latest code from the usual place: http://moodle.org/mod/data/view.php?d=13&rid=557&filter=1 There are updated installation instructions in the wiki for a brand new 9.5/3.0 install or if you have upgraded from an older version of Elluminate which already had the custom Moodle adapter installed as well. Those specific instructions can be found in the MoodleDocs wiki here: Deployment instructions of the new Moodle adapter (ELM 3.0) NOTE: If you are not using the latest version of Elluminate, the latest Moodle code will continue to work for you. The changes made are backwards-compatible with previous Elluminate versions.

ResponsesInList.Title: Elluminate 9.0 compatibility?
ResponsesInList.Text: Has anyone installed the Elluminate 9.0 update yet? Are there any known compatibility issues with the Moodle integration module? The reason why I'm asking is that we host our own Moodle (1.9) and Elluminate servers. I upgraded Elluminate from 8.5 to 9.0 per their directions, which were for a standalone system. I made no changes at all to the Moodle side. Since the upgrade, there have been reports of strange things when using Elluminate through Moodle. Last week, Elluminate was throwing authentication failures after the application loaded for anyone coming in through Moodle. Today, I have a report that a faculty member received a pink Moodle error box saying "You must be a moderator to create meetings" when he/she tried to add another Elluminate meeting to a Moodle course. Since we're in our winter break here, I'm not sure if the integration is 100% broken with nobody using it, or if these are random problems. Anyway, I was wondering if we are the first site to do this upgrade, or if somebody else has Elluminate 9.0 successfully integrated which would indicate that I did something wrong when doing the upgrade.....
